summary:
A quarter century experience in the B2B data industry, focusing on the bigger picture: innovation, digital transformation, strategy and M&A. 

Experienced in product, data, AI, partnership management and innovation; assets used to drive strategy & new business for a market leading B2B player. Operational business experience through managing the Benelux region.

Leadership of both direct-report teams as managing through influencing in global matrix organisations.

Hands-on: managed and owned go-to-market, product development, research & analysis as well as customised client solutions in various industries across the globe.

A brief project presentation during the 2015 'Commit Comnunity Days' @ Papendal, Netherlands.

QUINN is a joint Radboud University/TNO/LexisNexis valorisation project to investigate applicabilaty of automated search suggestion functionality.

QUINN is a valorisation project of the larger TNO-led SWELL, and part of the Dutch COMMIT public/private R&D initiative.

projects.title: QUINN - QUERY UPDATES FOR NEWS MONITORING
projects.description: In the QUINN project a proof-of-concept is developed to support users of LexisNexis Publisher in keeping the topic queries up to date by providing them with timely suggestions for query modifications. The suggestions come from: (1) analysis of the news stream in order to find changes in topics (e.g. new names or new terminology) and (2) analysis of the documents from the stream that were viewed and selected by the user. For the development of the product we use the results from SWELL related to terminology extraction for user modelling.

projects.title: Metadata Extraction Services
projects.description:
A multi-disciplinary R&D project, funded by the dutch government. 
Key goal: extraction, integration and exploitation of rich metada from audiovisual information, including OCR (subtitles), speech-to-text, picture recognition and text mining. 

LexisNexis' role in the project consortium mainly consisted of building use cases and the business case, as well as collaborating with the other consortium partners (TNO, amongst others) to deliver a working prototype and perform user testing & evaluation.

projects.title: NewsReader
projects.description:
Problem addressed:
The volume of news data is enormous and expanding, covering billions of archived documents and millions of documents as daily streams, while at the same time getting more interconnected with knowledge provided elsewhere. Professional decision-makers that need to respond quickly to new developments and knowledge or that need to explain these developments on the basis of the past are faced with the problem that current solutions for consulting these archives and streams no longer work, simply because there are too many possibly relevant and partially overlapping documents and they still need to distinguish the correct from the wrong, the new from the old, the actual from the out-of-date by reading the content and maintaining a record in memory. Consequently, it becomes almost impossible to make well-informed decisions and professionals risk to be held liable for decisions based on incomplete, inaccurate and out-of-date information.

Our solution:
NewsReader will process news in 4 different languages when it comes in. It will extract what happened to whom, when and where, removing duplication, complementing information, registering inconsistencies and keeping track of the original sources. Any new information is integrated with the past, distinguishing the new from the old and unfolding story lines in a similar way as people tend to remember the past and access knowledge and information. The difference being that NewsReader can provide access to all original sources and will not forget any details. We will develop a decision-support tool that allows professional decision-makers to explore these story lines using visual interfaces and interactions to exploit their explanatory power and their systematic structural implications. Likewise, NewsReader can make predictions from the past on future events or explain new events and developments through the past. The tool will be tested by professional decision makers in the financial and economic area.

projects.title: Crowd Connection
projects.description:
A joint KPMG-Chaordix-LexisNexis crowd sourcing project, to harvest the wisdom of the crowd on the topic of Big Data opportunities in B2B, where I coordinated LexisNexis' participation in the 'trojka'.

We worked with 3 different 'crowds': university students, KPMG employees and Reed Elsevier/LexisNexis employees, totalling over 1500 individuals, gathering useful insights on commercial opportunities in the area of Big Data.

projects.title: Dutch-language classification
projects.description:
LexisNexis Benelux worked with NL-based Irion Technologies and LexisNexis US on a system that automatically applies topical indexing to Dutch-language documents. Classification is based on existing, LN-developed, taxonomies (recently, IPTC subject classification has been added).

Joint optimalisation of taxonomies and training data, setup of internal training programme, development and implementation of data workflow.
